newsitem.title: USA: Auto sales in U.S. off 2.0 pct July 21-31 - CNW.
newsitem.headline: Auto sales in U.S. off 2.0 pct July 21-31 - CNW.

text.p: Auto sales in the United States fell 2.0 percent during July 21-31 compared with the same period a year ago, according to a report by CNW Marketing/Research.
During the survey period, sales of domestic autos fell 2.9 percent, and U.S. sales of imports rose 3.0 percent.
Specifically, domestic car sales dropped 4.1 percent, to 275,291 from 287,102, CNW said. Domestic truck sales slipped 0.8 percent, to 171,361 from 172,689, it said.
Import car sales advanced 4.5 percent to 62,237, while import truck sales fell 1.9 percent to 16,591, the report said.
Year-to-date, vehicle sales in the United States reached 8,994,362, off 3.3 percent from the same period of 1996, according to CNW.
